issue.title: [CI] Change jinja macros to not require CROSSBOW_TOKEN to upload artifacts in Github Actions
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12484](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12484). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12484?focusedCommentId=17332049) by Anthony Louis Gotlib Ferreira (anthonylouis):*
- Actually, in the last step of some scripts, they upload the generated artifacts and create a release.
   \* To create a release from the Github Actions, all found scripts need a token with some access permissions.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12484?focusedCommentId=17341065) by Anthony Louis Gotlib Ferreira (anthonylouis):*
I found that we can use the Github Actions default token to upload the release. It is defined by **secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN** variable.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12484?focusedCommentId=17341423) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
